text: vivo is currently working on the X200 Ultra, its absolute flagship smartphone for 2025. Today a new leak from China brings us a few interesting details about its cameras. The phone will reportedly have a triple rear camera setup just like its predecessor, with a 50 MP main shooter, a 50 MP ultrawide, and a 200 MP periscope telephoto camera. The main camera will have a large aperture and OIS. The X200 Ultra will capture 4K120fps video on all cameras, and will feature a new generation of vivo's self-developed imaging chip. Additionally, switching cameras while recording video has been streamlined. Finally, the design of the camera island has been slightly changed, and apparently should look better than the X100 Ultra's. Speaking of which, the X100 Ultra got official back in May, so we may still be quite a few months away from the introduction of its successor. Unfortunately, unlike the X200 and X200 Pro which have recently made it to Western markets, the X200 Ultra is rumored to only be officially sold in China. vivo X200 These are the best offers from our affiliate partners. html:
vivo is currently working on the X200 Ultra, its absolute flagship smartphone for 2025. Today a new leak from China brings us a few interesting details about its cameras.

The phone will reportedly have a triple rear camera setup just like its predecessor, with a 50 MP main shooter, a 50 MP ultrawide, and a 200 MP periscope telephoto camera. The main camera will have a large aperture and OIS.

The X200 Ultra will capture 4K120fps video on all cameras, and will feature a new generation of vivo's self-developed imaging chip. Additionally, switching cameras while recording video has been streamlined. Finally, the design of the camera island has been slightly changed, and apparently should look better than the X100 Ultra's.

Speaking of which, the X100 Ultra got official back in May, so we may still be quite a few months away from the introduction of its successor. Unfortunately, unlike the X200 and X200 Pro which have recently made it to Western markets, the X200 Ultra is rumored to only be officially sold in China.
